title: Do you ever get the impression that Riot Support hates players who play Off-Meta?

embed.description: r/leagueoflegends: This is a subreddit devoted to League of Legends.

body:
So I was looking at that post about instilling the will to win and comeback victories etc thread, and some guy posted that despite doing great against the odds he ends up banned on his account **_For Playing Ezreal Support_** which is pretty darn hilarious. Personally, I think we still live in a highly toxic community that disavows any attempt to play the game differently than what they are used to, punishing players at low rank for their ingenuity and creativity while raising them on a pedestal for putting a low rank strategy into use at a high rank. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/A5AE4R4N-the-key-to-instilling-your-teammates-with-hope-and-the-will-not-to-give-up?comment=0000

replies.body: Ezreal is quite gold reliant and has 0 utility, I'd say he is an awful example for an off-meta support.

> [{quoted}](name=C0l0urless,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GFIVL8Tv,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-11-23T20:11:15.923+0000)
>
> Ezreal is quite gold reliant and has 0 utility, I'd say he is an awful example for an off-meta support.

That's only if you discredit his personal flash ability, which essentially lets him bait the enemy team into positions they don't want to be in. High mobility poking is a fair supporting method, like people picking malphite support and spamming Q at the enemy.

That's still worse and has a much narrower application compared to what other supports (even off-meta ones) can do.

High mobility poking on a support is fine, but the problem with Ez is that he can't do anything to protect the ADC.

> [{quoted}](name=C0l0urless,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GFIVL8Tv,comment-id=000600010000,timestamp=2018-11-24T00:26:24.943+0000)

Besides being a threat, a deterrent, or maybe he makes the ultimate sacrifice and jumps in front of the ADC to block a thresh grab or an Ashe ult, etc. Thank you Ezreal Supports of the world, I hope I get 20 in a row! But only if you've practiced it sufficiently and understand your role! 

{{sticker:sona-playing}}

> Besides being a threat

Too bad Ezreal depends on having gold to actually deal damage

> a deterrent

We have Zyra/brand that can deal 10x the damage ezreal does in AOE (with much less gold btw), and the other supports that aren't damage carries can still deterrent enemy players with CC and peal, so once again Ezreal fails.

> or maybe he makes the ultimate sacrifice and jumps in front of the ADC to block a thresh grab or an Ashe ult

Implying you need Ezreal's E to do that when legit any support champion can do that with good positioning, but if you really wanted a support just for that one job look no further because riot already have these 3 perfect for that job {{champion:223}} {{champion:497}} {{champion:201}}

> Implying you need Ezreal's E to do that when legit any support champion can do that with good positioning, but if you really wanted a support just for that one job look no further because riot already have these 3 perfect for that job {{champion:223}} {{champion:497}} {{champion:201}}

You can use the Ezreal E to effectively against a Blitzcrank hook by body blocked for your ADC.

{{champion:12}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:223}} = supports that don't cared about getting hook cause they have the tankyness to survive early on

{{champion:25}} {{champion:223}}  = Do I really need to explain why morg and kench are here?

{{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:44}} {{champion:412}}  = If the adc got hooked over these its not instant win unless the adc was low already, because nothing is stopping that adc you just pulled from turning onto your ad instead when their support is ready to cc your adc, the only two adcs' where this doesn't matter is if the blitz is supporting draven/lucian.

Translation: Stop trying to justify Ezreal support when actual support champions can do anything he has to offer as support 10x better.

> [{quoted}](name=ı Sona ı,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GFIVL8Tv,comment-id=000600010000000000010000,timestamp=2018-11-26T08:11:55.502+0000)

And that's better than actual support champs using real keystones that buffs their play style with zero downsides how? 

Also Kelpto will NOT make up for the fact that Ezreal will not be getting any gold from minions because he is the support {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

He isn't much of a threat tho, especially compared to other damage supports and him having to sacrifice himself to save the ADC from a hook isn't good either, considering many supports could do it and live.

I played him both pre and post re-work.  His w used to grant attack speed.

Your gold generation is pretty good at least in bronze elo because many enemy adc's / support's don't make a great effort to dodge q's. You build the blue support item and you get lots of extra gold with Q because of klepto(the old klepto anyway haven't gotten to test the new one really).

Then you just build a tear with iceborn later and you have some slow utility and a damage spike as soon as you transform your tear item which typically happens in under 25 minutes.  Great to poke down enemies when behind or ahead as long as teams are grouping but not engaging.

Hmm, I guess I didn't account for them letting you get Klepto procs, but I am still not the biggest fan of it.

The lack of utility early game when you arguably need it most seems quite bad and is made worse by the fact damage supports like Brand probably still out-damage you.

Yes, I will concede Brand has better burst damage and cc.  But, I don't have the blue essence available to purchase him.  Do you have any cheaper poke style support recommendations?

Also, I really like the mobility Ezreal provides.  If the enemy team locks in Blitzcrank I can save any ADC in lane if I'm playing Ezreal by tanking hooks and shifting out after.

> Yes, I will concede Brand has better burst damage and cc. But, I don't have the blue essence available to purchase him. Do you have any cheaper poke style support recommendations?

Fiddlesticks is cheap and I heard he is quite annoying to deal with.

Edit: I remembered a few more good ones: Soraka (does quite a lot of damage if you max E first), Zilean and Lux (she is more expensive unfortunately).

> Also, I really like the mobility Ezreal provides. If the enemy team locks in Blitzcrank I can save any ADC in lane if I'm playing Ezreal by tanking hooks and shifting out after.

I don't think that's enough of a pro, considering Pyke can do the same, Morgana can block the hook while also being capable of negating other CC and tank supports are often undesirable hook targets.
i'd say with new klepto that gold farming with ez against a melee support would be totally viable
It still leaves the problem you can't actually support until you buy iceborn.

Played into a melee support with proper positioning you could apply enough pressure to get your adc through the laning phase and later gear up to be another carry later in the game.  As long as he's getting the adc through the lane phase he's "actually supporting" CC and peel don't necessarily have to come from the support role.
Most ADCs cannot protect themselves, especially in the early game, so even getting them through the laning phase might be hard while you have no utility.

at this point almost every adc has some kind of self peel/CC or mobility and if not they can spec into it sustain which most of them do anyway.

Ezreals form of protection is pressure by constantly throwing skill shots.  You hit great, but with the mobility on his e he can exert pressure higher up the lane allowing his adc to position safely.  The pressure he provides in lane is what keeps the adc safe.  Move to midgame he can then pick up side waves and now you've got 2 carries coming out of the bot lane as opposed to 1.

This is also all keeping in mind ez is warding and sweeping because within this role he still has primary responsibility over vision.  Not that everyone else should be ignoring it either.

I want to also make clear that, in my opinion, ezreal support is not a pick that can be played with/into any comp.  Its niche and pocket pick at best.

His skill shots don't provide enough of a threat to gain pressure against conventional supports, since they have lower base damage and don't travel through minions and with his lack of utility the enemy will always be able to kill your ADC if they manage to land CC on him. The aspect of him becoming a second carry is also underwhelming since support like Brand can do the same without needing to take CS.

Vision control is something every champion is capable of so this isn't any kind of big plus either.

I don't see a viable niche for him since the enemy support would pretty much have to be useless for it to work.

Back in season 5 I climbed to diamond with jungle Sona. I had to face the same rhetoric every day - "your pick is not optimal and you should be banned".

It was as optimal as it gets. It was perfect for my strengths and it covered my weaknesses as a human. It was surprisingly cheesy, functioning completely different to other junglers, making counterjungling nearly impossible - I developed weird paths and untilized different smites specifically to play around enemy invades. It was a decent dueling pick. It was a lategame carry.

People in my lobbies did not know or believe it. They could not crack it. So they flamed all the time and, you can be sure, I accumulated quite a few reports in those days, especially in the games I lost.

Jungle got reworked, meta shifted. She doesn't carry me to diamond anymore, but I am still playing her from time to time. Just like I play Sona mid and Sona bottom as a carry.

You do not know strengths of support Ezreal. You can not crack it like that in a forum thread. Your idea that the player has to be banned because it doesn't perform in your head is directly harmful for the game, shutting down sparks of creativity and potentially harrassing people doing something great that you fail to understand. Do you believe it doesn't work? Well, there is MMR to judge what works and what doesn't work. Who is next? People with high ping? People maining tier 2 meta champions? People unable to kite on ad carry?

Jesus, merely having this conversation disgusts me. Reading this thread I want to distance myself from forum community more than ever.

Shame on you, people. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Yes!
I feel a little inspired after this.  When my suspension is up and when pre-season is over I'm going to try and see how high I can climb as an Ezreal support main.  Hopefully, I won't get banned :)

Just look at all the diversity in botlane. 
Then look at most of the botlane mains complain and beg for nerfs only vs that diversity. Just an example.

The more the game  changes the more people want it to stay the same

This is what alot of off-meta players being complaining for YEARS! Pick and play off-meta.

RIOT supports: This is not how this champion is supposed to play! *Suspend account*

Seriously....sometimes whoever worked as RIOT supports really really bad at doing their jobs! Intentional feeders and Toxic players running free while off-meta players get banned for nothing!
To be fair, after Ezreal's latest rework, he can no longer trigger Summon Aery on allies.

Something to consider is that yes there are people in player support who hate off meta picks.  That is because player support is composed of a large number of humans who each have their own opinions.

It is worth noting that you have provided one case where someone did get banned, and in the comments someone had their ban get overturned.  Riot has rules about this specifically to handle the fact that people think differently.

You also aren't going to hear about the times people didn't get a punishment when player support looked over a game because.... no one except the player support agent would even know it was a possibility.

But I guess we don't focus on the positive side enough so here are some examples where I didn't get banned:

I just played 3 games as Nasus, Xerath, and Karthus as APC with an AP rek'sai support each game.  We won 2/3 of them and no one so much as commented on our picks in a single one of the games.

I used to play quite a bit of support J4 with flag max Aery and items like Ardent Censor and Grail.  There was only 1 times someone got seriously upset and 2-3 other times where people were offput by it at all.

Season 4 frozen mallet Ashe support.

I play Kassadin support.

I played an AP Kog'maw support game where everyone was quite supportive of me.

In other positions I have been playing J4 Mid for a long time as well as the occasional Vi mid game.

Jhin top is funny and I have never gotten flamed for that even when I feed.

People are cool with whatever role I play Thresh/Taric in.  Taric Jg is a favourite.

My Poppy builds usually end up being full AD and sometimes appear in the bot lane.

AD Elise Top anyone?  Will admit I got flamed fairly hard in one of those games but for the most part it wasn't too bad.

Renekton Support is a mean pick.

Blitz Top into Irelia is a favourite of mine now.

Tank Karma Top.

Quinn Mid.

I don't think I have ever been flamed for playing AD Soraka except in an ARAM game of all things.

AP Raka top is also pretty funny.

Got an Aatrox support game in that went really well.

Darius support has always done well by me, and my team never complains.

I played old Aatrox in any of the 5 positions and no one ever flamed.

I do always ask first so it might not count but I have never gotten flamed for reviving the River Shen meme.

-------------------------------------------------

Sure I get flamed on occasion, but y'know what?  For how often I play off meta I really do get flamed more for being a terrible ADC player than for doing off meta stuff, and I have never once been so much as warned for any kind of behavior by player support.

Yes its fine that you weren't banned, but there are multiple examples of it happening in earlier seasons with the big ones being a couple smite Supports, a Support Nunu and a Support Singed.  The Nunu was noted for being toxic but Riot defended the Support Singed ban on the basis of it being too disruptive for an adc player.

Frankly, I'd rather ban people who actually int rather than ban people who are off meta.  I know these people would get banned sometimes if we started actually banning inters, but the fact that someone who plays Support Ezreal gets banned over someone who basically steals jungle camps, walks down lanes, and steals kills to pad their stats while not engaging gets to ruin my games and continue playing is fucking absurd.  If both got banned and the false ban got revoked that'd be one thing, but most gameplay infractions that aren't a Rammus running down mid with a bunch of zeals are totally ignored and the most common case of false bans are off-meta picks.

Its reasonable for people to be concerned that this is a thing.  Its not reasonable to say Rioters should be fired but its going to hurt player trust to just outright ban people for trying something so they shouldn't be surprised when they allow people the authority to do this and there's no repercussions that people are mad.  They don't even give compensation RP or anything like they used to in previous seasons, you lose time on the game for a false crime and they spit you out back out into the system... if you got banned for off meta picks do you think you'd still be wanting to actively play them or would you think about how you could be reported and have concerns about it?

I'd 100% ban everyone who plays an "off-meta" support and it has nothing to do with whether or not the pick is off-meta.

It's because it's support and 99.999999999% of the time when someone wants to play an "off-meta" support, or in other words a carry in a support role, it's because they were auto-filled into support and they want to K.S. the actual carry, use the fact that they have a couple kills as an excuse to start taking C.S., jungle buffs, more kills from other carries, etc...

This happens all the fucking time and it always stems from the mentality that these people refuse to support anyone but themselves, even at the expense of everyone else's chances of winning the game.

shouldn't we remove autofill tho, seems to solve the problem, and i play off meta supports because i can't farm for shit, but in support with the support item i can get a lot of gold and still pop off

People aren't learning how to play support, they're learning how to circumvent playing support when autofilled as support without being punished for it under the guise of "playing an off-meta pick and that should be okay."

So maybe we should learn how to do one of two things :

A ) Encourage and teach people how to effectively play support so that they don't do it.
B ) Find a way to punish people for doing it.

It seems only logical, as opposed to today's standard of "Just fucking deal with it and if you complain, you'll be punished."

Again, I am not talking about people who are actually playing an off-meta pick as a support, to support.  I'm talking about people playing carries as a support, not playing as a support, not itemizing as a support, not vision controlling as a support, intentionally KS'ing carries, pushing lanes themselves, etc...

No, the conversation is about banning people not playing as a support while being autofilled into the support role.

That includes, but is not limited to, viability.  You want it to be ONLY about what items they build.

If you're going to pick a champion that has zero viability as a support just to say that you can't itemize as a support so that you can build damage, then you're taxing your team by your choices.

You don't arbitrarily get more gold in-game because you're a carry in the support role.  It doesn't come out of thin air.  You have to take it from someone else on the team.

The moment you get into completely abnormal choices like Darius support, you should be at the mercy of your team, _if_ it detracts from your responsibilities as a support.

Again, if you want to play Darius support and you build support and you fight for vision, etc... then I personally don't have a problem with it.  I'm also one person.

Whether or not I think it's okay, doesn't necessarily mean that your team mates think it's okay.  I believe someone from Riot, years ago, coined it best, when they were talking about you needing to get permission from your team prior to forcing them into any off-the-wall decisions.

It's only fair to the 4 other people on your team that you're about to gamble the game with, to ask if they're alright with it.

It Does Not Matter What The Strategy Is If It wins. It does not matter if you don't LIKE the strategy it if it wins.
